entry.title: newsletter #122
entry.content:
Hi there!

This week we had a very nice lighting talks session, we will have a post about it next week, also don’t forget that We’re hiring backend-ers,

and here are the weekly links,

Enjoy!

entry.title: Newsletter #116
entry.content:
Hi folks!

Yet another photo of Alex, Cirpo and Oba from DockerCon Europe 2015.

Also, we celebrated Prabeesh’s birthday by giving Lucio as a birthday present; not sure if he liked it but he seemed happy.

Below you can find the usual list of interesting articles we discovered in the past 7 days.

  • 8 tips about overcoming impostor syndrom

  • a quick guide to peer code review (and why you should do it)

  • after docker: unikernels and immutable infrastructure

  • chatting about chatops from atlassian summit – atlassian developers

  • dance to calypso – wordpress -php +react/nodejs

  • deploying with git-flow, tags and circleci

  • javascript swap in-place array elements

  • magento/magento2

  • one-click deploy for service oriented architectures – kate heddleston (software engineer) – youtube

  • pinboard tips for web design

  • random writings and thoughts about python: openbsd support for psutil

  • react-starter for beginners

  • simple o(n2) sorting algorithms in javascript

  • software and entrepreneurship with seth godin – software engineering daily

  • support for older versions of internet explorer ends on january 12, 2016

  • the craft of collaboration

entry.title: Newsletter #105
entry.content:
Hi! It’s TechThursday again!

To prove that we are not joking around we are porting microservices (sometimes not that micro) to the basketball playground! :P

This is a picture of our team mates after a 3 vs 3 session!

And here’s your reading list for the weekend!

Enjoy!

  • A heads up display for git

  • A week with elixir

  • BDD vs TDD – western devs

  • Billion-dollar companies over the last decade

  • Billions of request per day meet go 1.5 — medium

  • Building a simple react application using the flux pattern: a step-by-step guide | tony spiro

  • Building price-aware applications using ec2 spot instances

  • Cross compiled go with alpine linux and docker

  • Daily stand-up meetings are a good tool for a bad manager – yegor bugayenko

  • Ever seen a container named boring_wozniak?

  • How to share docker volumes across hosts

  • Life of a ticket – airbnb engineering

  • Making painless schema changes

  • Min-maxing software costs

  • news.js.org: spreading the news about javascript since 2015

  • Presentation domain data layering

  • Stop using react for everything!

  • Stream faqs

  • Symptom-based monitoring at ticketmaster

entry.title: Newsletter #66
entry.content:
Hey folks from the software engineering community!

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Our comrade Alex is at SymfonyCon Madrid with an awesome and super exciting talk about angular.

Next week, Oba, Lucio and Alex will be at the super exciting Docker Eu Conference to collect some thoughts about the newest technologies.

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the week:

  • SERIOUS CONFUSION with Resource Timing

  • What’s in a Function Name?

  • The Real Cost of Slow Time vs Downtime

  • Microsoft brings Docker CLI to Windows

  • Rocket Internet-Backed Jumia Raises $150M For Its African E-Commerce Business

  • What is product design?

  • An interactive guide for exploring various important properties of the package.json for node.js apps

  • A Programmer Describes How He Nearly Went Insane Learning To Code

  • Codewars, improve your programming skills

  • React Tube Tracker – a simple application to check the predicted arrival times of trains at stations on the London Underground network built with React.

  • Yahoo! Mail moving to React

  • Docker vs VMs

  • Create your own Docker image

  • Service discovery with consul and consul-template

  • Building a complete Tweet index

  • VclFiddle is an online tool for experimenting with the Varnish Cache HTTP reverse-proxy

  • Sometimes Kill -9 Isn’t Enough

  • Performance Tuning EC2 Instances

  • Web-based PostgreSQL database browser

  • Go and JSON

  • Aurora on Amazon RDS

  • AWS Public IP Address Ranges Now Available in JSON Form

  • Which configuration management tool should you use?

  • A Saltstack salt-api and reactor formula for integrating HTTP webhooks with Saltstack executions

  • Jenkins: saltstack-plugin
